title: Patricia Green Cellars 2016 Durant Vineyard Madrone Block Pinot Noir (Dundee Hills)
description: This is based upon a single Dijon 115 clone, and delivers potent ripe black-cherry flavors. It's a full-throttle bottle, textural and lightly touched with dried seaweed. The barrel aging adds a welcome touch of chocolate to the powerful tannic finish.

title: Ponzi 2015 Avellana Vineyard Chardonnay (Chehalem Mountains)
description: This bright, big and mouthfilling wine was fermented with wild yeast, which seems to infuse it with a dollop of mystery. Ultraripe lemon and grapefruit come with a hint of marshmallow and plenty of toasted-peanut flavors. It finds a smooth runway and coasts gently to a gliding stop, with those toasty flavors still resonating.

title: Prats & Symington LDA 2015 Post Scriptum de Chryseia Red (Douro)
description: Based at Quinta de Roriz in the Douro, this wine is produced by a joint venture between the Prats family of Bordeaux and the Symington family of the Douro. Made as a second wine to Chryseia, it is soft and rich, with great tannins and ripe fruit. Black currants and acidity go together with a young, dry core. Drink from 2020.

title: Quinta da Romaneira 2015 Vintage  (Port)
description: The texture of this wine balances tannins and ripe black fruits. The perfumes and the crisp acidity come through strongly. These elements make for a dense wine, with a dry core and a rich surround. It will be best from 2026.

title: Quinta Nova de Nossa Senhora do Carmo 2015 Referência Grande Reserva Red (Douro)
description: Based on old Tinta Roriz vines, this elegant wine is ripe and densely structured, with good balance between red fruits and juicy acidity. It is a wine to age for several more years. Drink from 2021.
winery: Quinta Nova de Nossa Senhora do Carmo

title: Talisman 2014 Wildcat Mountain Vineyard Pinot Noir (Sonoma Coast)
description: Exhibiting all that one could hope from a coastal site, this wine offers earthy rose petal aromas around a tightly wound core of forest and tea. Structured tannin provide a framework for secondary characteristics to develop in the glass, from cranberry and orange peel to Asian five spice.

title: Whistler 2014 Estate Grown Estate Pinot Noir (Sonoma Coast)
description: This is a light, ethereal and hugely satisfying wine, delicately layered and soft in texture. Huckleberry, Asian five spice and forest floor figure prominently along a succulent persistence of acidity and salty freshness.

title: WildAire 2015 Fairsing Vineyard Pinot Noir (Yamhill-Carlton)
description: This single-vineyard wine is rock solid, with punchy black-cherry fruit, a streak of mineral and a sprinkling of coffee grounds. Clean earth and graphite add more complexity, and the tannins—ripe and sturdy—provide a perfect foundation. The wine was aged for 17 months in one-third new French oak, and should drink well into 2028.

title: Ashes & Diamonds 2014 No. 1 Grand Vin Merlot-Cabernet Franc (Oak Knoll District)
description: This is an inaugural blend of 75% Merlot and 25% Cabernet Franc made by Dan Petroski of Larkmead for the new producer. The grapes come from vineyards located near the winery in Oak Knoll. Dried herb de Provence aromas invite one in to mingle with aspects of cedar, pencil and red currant, the style subdued and soft. Layers of quiet power and oak lie beneath the fruit.

title: Badge 2014 Syrah (Santa Barbara County)
description: Candied black cherry, rosebuds, violets and a minty tobacco quality all show on the nose of this countywide blend by Bruno D'Alfonso. It commands attention on the palate, showing black currant, blueberry, black-pepper-crusted beef and candied violet flavors, balanced by strong acidity.

title: Château Lalande-Borie 2015  Saint-Julien
description: A dense wine with great fruit, this has a velvet texture and great elegance. There is structure of course from the firm tannins that stay in the background, while the main thrust of this wine is its great blackberry fruit. It will age and should be drunk from 2025.

title: Château Mouton Rothschild 2015 Le Petit Mouton  (Pauillac)
description: This wine is dense and packed with tannins. Its weight and smoky character balance against the generous black currants. Juiciness and acidity go together with the generous structure. Drink from 2024.

title: Château Saransot-Dupré 2015  Listrac-Médoc
description: This rich wine comes from a historic estate in Listrac, dating to the 18th century. It offers tannins and a dry core as well as dark black fruits and acidity, giving the wine its structure and potential longevity. The wine will develop slowly and will be ready to drink from 2025.

title: Clos des Menuts 2015 L'Excellence  (Saint-Émilion)
description: Old vines on the estate, close to the ancient city walls of Saint-Émilion, produce this smoothly ripe wine. It is broad, generously rich with black fruits. The toast from wood aging will integrate with time. Wait until 2024 for this impressive wine to be ready to drink.

title: Château Anthonic 2015  Moulis-en-Médoc
description: The 70% of Merlot in the blend of this wine gives it richness and ripe red-berry fruits. The tannins, dusty and spicy, are a blend of the wood aging and the structure of the Cabernet Sauvignon. Ripe and juicy, the wine is packed with fruit and likely to age well. Drink from 2022.

title: Château Biston-Brillette 2015  Moulis-en-Médoc
description: Ripe, and densely textured, this wine shows an impressive, rich balance between fruit and tannins, with a dry core and broad black fruits that have great intensity. This wine, with 12 months in wood, conveys spice, concentration and excellent potential. Drink from 2024.

title: Château Couhins-Lurton 2015  Pessac-Léognan
description: With its fine fruit, and balanced acidity, this is a rich, structured wine. Its black-currant fruit is juicy and crisp, with a firm. dry background. The wine has good potential, opening to generous fruitiness as it ages. Drink from 2024.

title: Château Fourcas-Borie 2015  Listrac-Médoc
description: Made by the same winemaking team as the top estate of Château Ducru-Beaucaillou in Saint-Julien, this wine comes from a long-time Borie family estate. The wine, with its layers of rich blackberry fruits and firm, dusty tannins, is concentrated, dark and certain to age well. Drink from 2025.

title: Château Labat 2015  Haut-Médoc
description: Run by the Nony family, this 17-acre estate has produced a generous, rounded wine dominated by black fruits. The barrel aging has enhanced the black-currant flavors and the acidity. All these elements are coming together in a full wine that will age well. Drink from 2024.

title: Bishop's Peak 2014 Elevation Red (Paso Robles)
description: Roasted cocoa, espresso cream and caramel provide richness to the nose of this Cabernet Sauvignon-led blend, but there's also bright black raspberry fruit and hints of pepper and fennel to give complexity. The palate starts with a zip, which dissipates into flavors of lilac, blueberry and anise seed.

title: Château Brown 2017 Barrel Sample  (Pessac-Léognan)
description: 91–93. Barrel Sample. This is a finely perfumed wine, with a creamy texture of ripe yellow-stone and pineapple fruits. It is also crisply imbued with tight citrus flavors and a mineral character. Drink from 2020.

title: Château d'Issan 2017 Barrel Sample  (Margaux)
description: 91–93. Barrel Sample. Attractively fruity, this wine comes from an estate that lies close to the Gironde estuary. It is full, with layers of crisp and juicy black-currant fruit, with attractive acidity and a light touch of tannins. Drink from 2022.

title: Château Fonréaud 2017 Barrel Sample  (Listrac-Médoc)
description: 91–93. Barrel Sample. This estate is situated at the highest point in the Médoc, yielding fine, ripe wines. The wood is showing strongly, but so is the fruit. That makes for a ripe, full wine with plenty of blackberry flavors that will age well. Drink from 2023.

title: Château Palmer 2017 Alter Ego Barrel Sample  (Margaux)
description: 91–93. Barrel Sample. Soft and silky, this is a rounded, ripe wine. It has just enough gentle tannins to sustain the generous black fruits and acidity. This is going to be a ripe, fruity wine as it develops. Drink from 2022.

title: Château Branaire-Ducru 2017 Barrel Sample  (Saint-Julien)
description: 91–93. Barrel Sample. Crisp fruit and intense acidity are the hallmarks of this bright wine. Its tannins are a backdrop to the nervy fruit character and vein of minerality and refreshing acidity. Drink from 2023.

title: Château Malescot Saint-Exupery 2017 Barrel Sample  (Margaux)
description: 91–93. Barrel Sample. This is a fruit-driven wine, packed with a strong black-currant character and bright acidity. The tannins are light, though they lend ample structure for medium-term aging. It is more about freshness and attractive fruit. Drink from 2023.

title: Château Marquis de Terme 2017 Barrel Sample  (Margaux)
description: 91–93. Barrel Sample. Initial aromas suggest considerable wood aging. Once past those, though, the wine does have plenty of black fruits for balance. Don't expect long-term aging here; drink from 2022.

title: Château les Ormes Sorbet 2015  Médoc
description: This is a beautifully balanced, rich wine. A core of fine tannins is surrounded by ripe blackberry fruits. The wine seems accessible now, but those tannins will allow it to age well. It will be better to wait until 2022.

title: Château Lestage Simon 2015  Haut-Médoc
description: Ripe and densely textured, this is a plush, full-bodied wine. With swathes of rich black fruits and some firm tannins, it has good potential. The richness contrasts with the black-currant acidity that gives this otherwise dense wine a bright, crisp aftertaste. Drink from 2024.

title: Château Maurac 2015  Haut-Médoc
description: Purchased by Olivier Decelle, who also owns property in Saint-Émilion and a negociant business in Burgundy, this estate is producing impressive wines. This bottling is richly structured while preserving all the ripe blackberry fruits and intense acidity. Drink this wine from 2023.
